uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Interface Tool

All Known Implementing Classes:
PointEntryTool, SimpleTool, Gazetteer
public interface Tool

Tools will be used by Viewers to represent all forms of user interaction. A default set of basic tools already implement this interface: Zoom, Pan, and Select.
Other developers are free to add aditional tools as they see fit.
Perhaps the only tricky thing of note with tools is that they effectivly have two paint options. A transient paint option, which covers anything you do in the update method.
A fixed paint option, which covers anything you do in the paint method.
For almost all tools you should only need to use the transient paint option, please try to clean up after yourself! A few tools will use the paint option, see for example the NavigateTool. It is strongly recomended that you extend or at least look at SimpleTool when developing a new tool as this will make your life much easier. If you are not extending SimpleTool then you will probably need to try some of the following:
In setContext make a reference to the MouseStatus returned by v.getMouseStatus() so that you will always know what the user has been doing.

Version:
0.7.7.2 2 June 2000
Author:
James Macgill
See Also:
MouseStatus, SimpleTool

Field Summary
static int CLEAR
          This is the set of reason codes that can be sent to the update mehtod.
If you are using SimpleTool then these will be recast to seperate methods, however feel free to handle them directly in your own tool inside the update method if you wish.
Reasons M_ refer to mouse actions.

Method Detail

update

public void update(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int reason)
Your tool will have this method called with one of the reason codes listed above whenever the Viewer thinks that something has happend that you might be interested in.
If you extend SimpleTool then the different reson codes will be dispached to seperate methods.
Parameters:
reason - One of the above reason codes will provided to give you some indication of why the viewer thinks you might be interested.
g - A graphics object onto which you can scribble, draw or whatever onto. Its already set to XOR mode, just make sure to clean up!
Since:
0.7.7.2 June 6 2000

setContext

public void setContext(Viewer v)
When a tool is pased to a view the viwer will call this method to tell to tool who it belongs to. SimpleTool used this to good effect, and if you extend that then you will probably not have to worry about this method at all.
If you do want to build your tool from scratch however, then there are a couple of things you should consider doing in this method
First, and most obviusly, store a reference to v (perhaps in a variable called context)
Second, grab a reference to v.getMouseStatus() as this will always track what the user has been doing.
Parameters:
v - The viewer to which this tool should be attached. set to null if tool should detach.
Since:
0.7.7.2 June 6 2000
See Also:
MouseStatus, SimpleTool.setContext(uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Viewer)

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
For painting persitent graphics only. MOST TOOLS DO NOT NEED TO DO ANYTHING IN THIS METHOD.
Of all the tools provided by default only Navigate uses this as it requires a permenent on screen box.
Most tools should use the graphics object passed into the update method.
Parameters:
g - A Graphics object that references the viewers static screen buffer.
Since:
0.7.7.2 June 6 2000

getCursor

public java.awt.Cursor getCursor()
find the cursor most suitable for this tool.
Returns:
Cursor the best cursor for use on screen with this tool.
Since:
0.7.7.2 June 6 2000

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
provides a short name for this tool. The name should be suitable for inclusion in a menu or on a button.
Returns:
String The name of this tool.
Since:
0.7.9 November 23 2000

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
provides a description for this tool. The description should briefly describe the purpose of the dool
Returns:
String A description of this tool.
Since:
0.7.9 November 23 2000
